item.title: Introduction to Real Analysis (TA)
item.description:
Course Overview

As a teaching assistant for Introduction to Real Analysis, I supported students in understanding fundamental concepts of real analysis, including limits, continuity, differentiation, and integration. The course focused on developing rigorous mathematical reasoning and proof-writing skills.

Responsibilities

  • Led weekly recitation sessions to reinforce lecture material and address student questions
  • Graded homework assignments and exams, providing detailed feedback to help students improve
  • Held regular office hours to provide additional support and clarification
  • Collaborated with the course instructor to develop effective teaching materials and assessments

Teaching Approach

In my recitation sessions, I focused on active problem-solving and conceptual understanding. I created additional practice problems that bridged the gap between routine exercises and more challenging proof-based questions. I encouraged students to articulate their reasoning clearly and precisely, emphasizing the importance of mathematical rigor.

Impact

Students in my recitation sections showed improved performance on proof-writing tasks and demonstrated greater confidence in tackling complex problems. I received positive feedback for my clear explanations and approachable teaching style.
